page.title: 19A GAMEKEEPER
page.content: Gamekeeping is a profession and not as some people believe,a hobby.It can involve looking after and breeding pheasants,organising private shoots (which occur around six times a year), the maintenance of the woodlands he patrols which still includes some coppicing and controlling pests.The gamekeeper does not use his gun as much for this purpose as people think. He mainly uses traps which are protected so that pheasants,which the landowners breed,can't get injured.The main pests which he has to control are foxes,rabbits,pigeons,magpies and squirrels.Often the gamekeeper has permission to shoot any domestic pets which may be endangering the pheasants.These are kept in enclosures to stop animals hunting them.When they are young their wings are clipped to stop them flying before they should.
